name: Array Labs
headline: We're building satellites to create a real-time 3D map of the world.
description:
We're designing swarms of tiny satellites which will work together to create the first real-time, high-resolution 3D model of the earth. 

By using clusters of satellites to image the same place on the earth at the exact same time, we can improve image quality by more than 60x over conventional techniques. 

This technology will massively increase the amount of affordable, high-quality 3D data, enabling a host of new applications across an array of industries, including AR/XR/Autonomy, Defense, Climate/ESG, and Insurance Analytics.

founders.name: Andrew Peterson, Founder
founders.description: Previous to being CEO at Array Labs, Andrew led teams across a number of remote sensing projects, including contributions to the Vera Rubin Observatory (largest telescope in the world), satellite constellation design, and high-resolution radar imaging systems. He holds B.S. and M.S. degrees in Aerospace Engineering.

founders.name: Jose Isaac Robledo, Founder
founders.description: Previous to joining Array Labs, Isaac lead business development efforts and conducted financial analysis for companies such as Sunstone Properties Trust, Morgan Stanley, and JLL, improving operational efficiency and assisting in the closing of over $500M in investments. He holds a B.S. in Economics from BYU.

generated_description:
**Array Labs: Mapping the Future**

Array Labs is on a mission to revolutionize how we view and understand our planet. They are developing swarms of tiny satellites with the ambitious goal of creating a real-time, high-resolution 3D map of the Earth. By deploying clusters of satellites to capture images of the same location simultaneously, they can boost image quality by over 60 times compared to traditional methods. This isn't just an incremental improvement; it opens the door to a vast amount of affordable, high-quality 3D data.

What makes this tech so exciting? The potential applications span multiple industries. Think about augmented reality (AR), extended reality (XR), autonomous systems, defense, climate monitoring, environmental, social, and governance (ESG) initiatives, and insurance analytics. The implications for better data-driven decisions in these areas are enormous.

Founded in Y Combinator's Summer 2022 batch and based in Palo Alto, Array Labs appears poised to make a big splash in the satellite industry, supported by their Group Partner, Jared Friedman. Although the team size is not stated, their vision is already making waves.

For those interested in what they offer, they provide high-quality 3D imagery and showcase various use cases designed to power new perspectives on the world. 

You can dive deeper into their work or possibly join their team by visiting their website: [Array Labs](https://www.arraylabs.io/). Keep an eye on this company; they might just help us see the world in a whole new light.
